channel.title: Indicating Client Versions
channel.description:
With the new client, the version # isnt just stuck out anymore, whether or not you know, the version is still there, just like always, but its not blatantly obvious, its in the same spot its been in the old engine too.
For example: in deob 377
[code] System.out.println("RS2 user client - release #" + 377); [/code]
very obvious.
with the current versions, they boosted the version to 400, if i had to guess right For Example, from Krichevskoy's deob: [code] this.method21(503, false, 403, 32 - -Class22_Sub1.modeWhat, 765); [/code]
if you just glance, you'll be like, oh some ints and a variable, well 403 is the current client version, the current is 408. its easy to see if you open with cfparse or something
bipush #43 [b]sipush #408[/b] sipush #765 sipush #503
so at least now we can go on about posting the correct version and whatnot
this may be a VERY pointless post, but oh well, thought it might be worth it, about 3/4 of the way of making this i saw how idiotic my thoughts were of obtaining the version, so this post became very uneducational.

item.title: Indicating Client Versions
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

The release number is including house-builds.

Hence why I call that the build version.

Read full topic

item.title: Indicating Client Versions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Nerice:

omg, Mopar is going to have 2000 noobs asking how to get the deob to even load so they can get into the game, so they can complain they got banned after finally getting logged in.

Double whammy for you mopar.

lol, no way im releasing this to the public for at least a long while (Krichevskoy even told me I couldnt lol ;D)

Read full topic

item.title: Indicating Client Versions
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Ha, so #400 is already past...pity, I was going to try to get everyone to plan a giant "Gratz Jagex 400!" no-bot day...no one but Jagex would have had the slightest clue what we were on about
Guess it happened anyway though, so...gratz Jagex.

With the new client, the version # isnt just stuck out anymore, whether or not you know, the version is still there, just like always, but its not blatantly obvious, its in the same spot its been in the old engine too.

in deob 377

System.out.println("RS2 user client - release #" + 377);

with the current versions, they boosted the version to 400, if i had to guess right
For Example, from Krichevskoy's deob:
